final_answer.precision_note: Reported to 3 significant figures, consistent with given current and time data

method: First convert time to seconds: t = 30.0 min × 60 s min-1 = 1800 s. Calculate total charge passed: Q = I × t = 1.50 A × 1800 s = 2700 C. Calculate moles of electrons: n(e-) = Q / F = 2700 C / 96500 C mol-1 = 0.02798 mol. From the half-equation Cu2+ + 2e- → Cu, 2 moles of electrons deposit 1 mole of copper. Therefore, n(Cu) = n(e-) / 2 = 0.02798 / 2 = 0.01399 mol. Calculate mass of copper: mass = n × Ar = 0.01399 mol × 63.55 g mol-1 = 0.8886 g, which rounds to 0.888 g to 3 significant figures.
checks: Copper(II) requires 2 electrons per atom, so moles of Cu is half moles of e-
Mass of copper less than 1 g is reasonable for 30 minutes at 1.5 A current
Significant figures consistent with input data (3 sig figs)
